abstract.p: Kristina A Goldstein letter scores 'insidious' practice of adding sugar to foods in which one would least expect to find it (Sept 12 article)

block.p: The Personal Health column ''Added Sugars Are Taking a Toll on Health'' (Sept. 12) focuses on certain foods like soft drinks, fruit drinks, breakfast cereals and processed foods like canned peaches -- all sweet tasting.

It is just as important to educate the public about the content of sugar in savory products. A closer look at supermarket items like soups, pasta sauces, salad dressings, ketchup, mayonnaise, peanut butter, bread, bread crumbs, croutons, crackers, to name a few, will reveal that sugar (often in the form of corn syrup) has been added to these.

It is just as important to educate the public about the content of sugar in savory products. A closer look at supermarket items like soups, pasta sauces, salad dressings, ketchup, mayonnaise, peanut butter, bread, bread crumbs, croutons, crackers, to name a few, will reveal that sugar (often in the form of corn syrup) has been added to these.
It is this insidious practice of adding sugar to foods in which one would least expect to find it that makes it so difficult to escape it, no matter how hard one tries.
